articles.title: Unpopular Policy of Suppression Flailed
articles.content:
Unpopular Policy of Suppression Flailed 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions reportedly made public a statement on November 18, vehemently condemning the government authorities' unpopular policy of suppression.
 The authorities egged the security forces on to arrest 42 participants in the "national rally of workers" and issue summons against Chairman Tan Pyong Ho and hardcore members of the KCTU and the Federation of Metal Industrial Trade Unions, the statement said, and went on:
 This shows that the authorities are taking the road of suppressing the just labour movement instead of taking measures regarding the protest struggle of workers.    
 The authorities should redress the present situation, realizing why workers, peasants and people are waging the protest struggle.

articles.title: S. Korean Professors of Laws Oppose Enactment of "Law on Combating Terrorism"
articles.content:
S. Korean Professors of Laws Oppose Enactment of "Law on Combating Terrorism" 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- 18 professors of laws including Kang Thae Su, professor at Kyunghee University in south Korea, reportedly issued a statement against the enactment of the "law on combating terrorism" on November 19.
 The statement charged that the law is an evil law against democracy and human rights aimed to set up a "center for combating terrorism," a tyrannical tool under the "Intelligence Service" following the "Central Intelligence Agency" or the "Security Planning Board," which were a pronoun of human rights abuses, and go back to the Cold War and the oppressive system.    
 The statement urged the "National Assembly" to stop considering the "bill on combating terrorism" and repeal it at once.

articles.title: Agreement on Cooperation between DPRK and Vietnam Signed
articles.content:
Agreement on Cooperation between DPRK and Vietnam Signed 
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in standardization, measuring and quality control between the DPRK Bureau for State Quality Control and the Directorate for Standards and Quality of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam was signed in Hanoi on November 20.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of a delegation of the Bureau for State Quality Control headed by Director Kim Hyong Chol and the DPRK ambassador to Vietnam and from the opposite side were the chief of the directorate for Standards and Quality and the vice-minister of Science and Technology.

Military Provocation by S. Korean Navy
articles.content:
Military Provocation by S. Korean Navy
    Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- South Korean battleships committed such grave military provocation as firing a barrage of gun shells at a patrol boat of the Navy of the Korean People's Army which was on a routine patrol duty in southwest waters of Wollae Islet at 13:10 on November 24, according to a military source.
 The south Korean military authorities should refrain from acting rashly, pondering over the grave consequences to be entailed by such reckless military provocation.

DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Meets Chinese Officials Concerned
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Meets Chinese Officials Concerned
    Beijing, November 25 (KCNA - Correspondent) --Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, separately met Member of the Chinese State Council Tang Jiaxuan, Foreign Minister Li Zhaoxing and Vice-Ministers of Foreign Affairs Dai Bingguo and Wang Yi and conversed with them over the issue of the bilateral relations and matters of mutual concern in Beijing between Nov. 22 and 24.
 He was staying there en route to Kuala Lumpur to attend the function of "DPRK Week" to be held there on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Malaysia.
